data.text: This app has been declining for a few months. I've been having the same glitches as everyone else, like weird autocorrect and capitalization. The new update is not good. Let us choose whatever size we want for our fonts. Why does it only go down to 8, and why can't we enter them manually? Additionally, I've been having a glitch that says that someone else is on the document I'm currently editing even when it's not shared with anyone. It's just annoying.

I've had no choice but to stop using this app. It keeps glitching, turning on caps when I don't want it to, and auto correcting when I don't want it to and not auto correcting when it's obvious that an auto correct is needed. It also pulls the latter paragraph to the current paragraph when it auto corrects a word when I'm editing the current paragraph. Don't get me started on it adding letters to words when I'm backspacing. I'm absolutely tired of this. Third update: Nothing has changed.

I've been experiencing the same issues as many others as far as random capitalizations, cursor jumping to the wrong paragraph, and autocorrecting words that shouldn't be corrected. I've tried clearing my cache and that didn't help. The thing is, this only happens on my Samsung S22 Ultra, but not my old Samsung Note 9 despite both having the latest update. Hopefully this might help you figure out where to look for the bugs in the code if you know it's only affecting newer model devices! Thanks!

Usually it's great and on a computer it works very well, but on mobile, it might be the most atrociously managed and technically trash app I've used. It's very disappointing. I literally type things in a note pad on my phone, so I can copy + paste it over to Docs on mobile just to be able to use it normally on PC. Very unfortunate, the random and fully wrong autocorrect and capitalization makes the app nearly unusable. Quite sad as it's a great idea and used to work excellently. Not worth it now

Convenient platform, buggy app... I love to use docs for my personal projects, and I have been doing so for years. It has worked wonders on desktop; however, for some reason, I experience random capitalization and autocorrecting proper words into.... vomit?? This only occurs on the app version in collaboration with my Samsung keyboard. I have been holding out hope that an update would fix this issue, but it has been nearly 2 months now. Please fix this. I am sincerely heartbroken.

Any other time, I would rate this as a five-star app, but since the last update, it has been incredibly glitchy. It's capitalizing random letters, and at odd times, it jumps you into the middle of a previous word while you're typing. I've also had it freeze in place, and as you type, it just changes the last letter. Update: The issues keep getting worse, not better. The advice and help site are useless. The app is close to unusable now. I'm looking for a replacement app.
data.replyText: Hi Victoria. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Your latest update, as of January 5th, 2024, had caused an issue where if you copy an image from one file, and paste to another file, it appears as an error. All these years, this was not an issue until 2024. This single mistake causes an efficiency issue, because no one wants to sift through their images over and over to replicate what they had done, when copy and paste is faster. FIX THIS.
data.replyText: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: I like using Google Docs on my laptop because it has speech to text capability. I am disappointed that that feature is not available in the app version. Speech to text helps me write my books as I am not that fast at typing, and having my eyes on the screen for long periods causes eye strain. With Speech to Text, I can close my eyes and just talk. Please add Speech to Text to the mobile version.
data.replyText: Hi Niccole. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within Docs app: click the 3 bar menu (top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it.

data.text: Ended up reviewing this about a month ago about being unable to access a document on my main email but it works on an alt. I've also reported other errors like completely crashing my docs. Originally I was willing to touch out to the support page they originally told me to go to, but their staff also just don't respond to anything. Perhaps I'm a tad impatient, but it's an important document and haven't had a response in a month. Usually love this app, but it's been worse lately.

I don't know what the hell happened to this app, but it keeps making incorrect corrections to my writing. It also doesn't highlight it's changes (like every other writing tool I've ever used), so I can't even fix it's mistakes. There's no way to disable auto-correct either, so it's basically unusable. It's gotten so bad that I write in other apps and only copy-paste text into this app when something needs to be formatted. I guess it's another victim of the ensh*tification.

Surely, Google cares enough about it's Chromebook users to incorporate a very simple scroll bar that does not disappear to resolve unwanted highlighting of text. I have received a response twice that is either automated or copy/paste. Reviews of the app have many examples of Chromebook users with the same error. The community is silent and even other platforms such as reddit offer no solutions that work. The generic resolutions are not effective. Please just give us an always active scroll bar.
data.replyText: Hi Gabriel. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: would be great if it didn't randomly set my shared documents **that I myself created** to view only, thus preventing me from making any further edits. would also be great if i could fix this from mobile, as i have no pc, and it says it can only be changed with pc. furthermore, i find that strange, since the only person i have shared one particular document with also has no pc. so overnight it mysteriously randomly set itself to view only. thanks google. (sarcasm.) it does this with sheets too.
data.replyText: Hello Will, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: I love Google. The need better instructions., in the help menu. Also how to move your files to the SD card. Suggest or offer free storage upgrade your storage you allow for each account to have. Q, Why do you run with Chrome? I don't like chrome, they have to many ads. That don't relate to the ones that you chose.

Used to work fine until it started randomly capitalizing words. I thought "I guess this must be because I've capitalized those words before," and brushed it off. Now it's randomly autocorrecting words to things that make no sense (think "a" to "stars", and is remaking letters that I've tried to delete. These things have made it practically unusable for me, and it's really annoying.

It's worked fine for years and then the last couple updates all of a sudden some of my documents won't show up on my phone. If I try to refresh the page then a couple more will pop up but if I do it again even those will disappear too. I've tried clearing the cache and it doesn't help. I had hoped the latest update would fix this issue but it hasnt.
data.replyText: Hi there. In order to find your documents in the app, we suggest you check if the account has synced: on your device, open settings - About phone - Google Account - Account sync - Docs (check for the last sync date). If not, toggle the option off and on and see if that works. Thank you.

data.text: Currently the app is not allowing me to edit a few documents... specifically, some documents I created. I'm trying to figure out why that is? And it's very frustrating. Edit: Clearing cache doesn't work, neither does deleting and redownloading the app. The app works fine on my tablet, it just isn't working right on my phone.
data.replyText: Hi Minty. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Docs has been my go-to program for several years primarily because I can write on my phone when I don’t have my laptop. Only now, the app no longer syncs. I have the final chapter of a book I've been working on, and the app only shows the original draft I started a month ago, despite numerous edits. I've uninstalled and reinstalled multiple times, but it still won't sync to the most recent version of the doc. This was never a problem before. It's maddening not to be able to write on my phone.
data.replyText: Hi Meredith. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: This is a wonderful app, I've used it to write my story and put down ideas. But, recently, I have been having some issues. When I'm writing, random words get capitalized (like This). It is very annoying, as I have to spend time making them lowercase again. Another thing is that the app sometimes glitches. when I movie to a new paragraph or try to delete a word, it takes me back to the original paragraph or doesn't delete/fix the word. (That's the best way I can describe it)
data.replyText: Hi there. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: I do love the app, but lately, it hasn't been automatically capitalizing the beginnings on sentences like it used to, and it randomly capitalizes or autocorrects for no reason, and using quotation marks and getting it to format normally without it trying to "fix" something has been such a hassle. It used to be great, but now it feels like such an inconvenience that those features that I've had for years are getting messed up.

This app works great for the most part, recent updates have fixed some crashing issues from previous updates which has been great. However, a very recent update turned on "smart quotes" with absolutely no way to turn them off in the app. Honestly, the fact that we can't change our preferences in the app at all is a huge annoyance. I had to get on my computer to go to the desktop to turn them off which is unnecessary and stupid, just give us preferences in the app.
data.replyText: Hi Hallie. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within Docs app: click the 3 bar menu (top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it!

data.text: It works fairly well, but the biggest complaint that I have is that st some point I'll starting getting a pop-up that reads "Can't detects more grammar errors. Text is too long." right at the bottom of the screen, and will persist while typing, blocking the view of what I'm trying to type! It happens far too often, and with no warning. Just at some point, starts doing that. Oftentimes right after sharing a document with someone via sharing link.

Decent replacement for Word, especially as it can read, edit, and create Word documents. However. It is missing the option to adjust spacing between paragraphs, which is present on the desktop website (which works fine on a tablet if you make your browser request the desktop website). There is no good reason to exclude this formatting option in the mobile app, especially when in many other respects a tablet is a passable replacement for a laptop. It also needs support for text boxes.

I use this almost every day, and for the most part it is similar to the web version so it is great for when I do not have my computer. However, I do wish deleting shared files was an option, as "removing from view" is pretty much pointless since the docs do come back. There are so many old documents I cannot delete because of this. Additionally, I wish you could add/edit summaries on mobile. But for the most part, it's a great app and I use it a lot. I just hope these two things get resolved ⚘️

I will say that the app is extremely useful on the go, but not if you're using it to write. It won't let me skip to chapter headings without completely crashing the app, so I have to take five minutes to scroll through my document to get to the end of the document, and the app will close any open documents after two minutes of being on another tab, so I can't pull references while on my phone. It's extremely disappointing to me, since I've been using this app for the better part of a decade.

No folder options, so finding documents is nearly impossible if you can't remember the name. But as a long time user, I can say it does it's job pretty well at least. It's a shame there's still no sorting system though. Especially after well over 4+ years. Otherwise, I would've given it a 5★ rating. I can't help but wonder if they're still working on updates, or if they just don't care enough.
data.replyText: Hi Barry. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within Docs app: click the 3 bar menu (top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it!

data.text: Normally I am happy with this App. But some recent update (not sure which one) started automatically replacing my straight quotes with "smart quotes". On PC, you can change this by going from Tools -> Preferences and unchecking "Use smart quotes", but I cannot find a similar option for the app, and the PC Preferences setting only applies to PC. This is incredibly annoying as the mobile keyboard has a way to include smart qhotes, but you can't use straight quotes anymore because they get replaced
data.replyText: Hi there. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within Docs app: click the 3 bar menu (top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback. Appreciate it!

data.text: The app is nice but its missing certain functions that the web version has. After reaching a few hundred thousand characters the slider disappears at the middle and lower part of the document which is a headache for editing. Recently an update took away the word count for highlighted texts, which was the only reason I use docs. Is this a glitch or error in a patch?

Nope. Still nothing but problems. I've been using computers since the eighties. I'm not a luddite. Trying to recover and older version of a file. Followed the online instructions. Nothing. The file will not open on the app or on the web. I'm sick of working months on something only to have it disappear or be unable to access, which is the same thing. Thank God I had the sense to back up most of it to txt files, so a years work is not all lost, just the edits, which will be bad enough. Trash.
data.replyText: Hi Thea. We recommend you check if there are any network connectivity issues or check this article to troubleshoot: https://goo.gle/3ONnjLM. You can also try clearing apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. Thank you.

data.text: UPDATE: tried dev solution and NOTHING! Files are disappearing-like my resume! I just moved & need it now! I even PAY for GoogleOne! I used to email docs to myself but everything worked well so I stopped doing it. I was able to pull the info from a job website but have to rewrite, reformat, etc. Time spent looking for it on Google apps plus the recovery from the website was valuable time that was lost. Do better! I've read the GoogleHelp advice & people's posts - they've all tried & failed.
data.replyText: Hi there. Sorry to hear you have this experience. You can follow the instruction here to restore files in Google Drive: https://goo.gle/3YRwfo6. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Hello. I would like to say that I do like this platform. However, I have encountered several problem in this apps, Such as receiving an error message when sharing documents with problems, The search algorithm being inaccurate most of the time, and not being able save documents. Also, The answers that Google provides to these reviews on this app is potentially copy & pasted (Possibly AI/Bot Generated) and not actually helpful most of the time. Thank you for reading this review.
data.replyText: Hi Ariana. You may post the query in Docs community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: The biggest issue I have right now is that I can no longer see the word/character count of highlighted text, which is something that I need to use frequently. The second biggest issue is that the app crashes constantly. The third, loading any large documents takes forever, if they don't crash the app first. I love using this app. It's convenient when it's not bugging out.

I've used Docs for years, specifically because of it's availability across multiple devices. Recently it's become virtually unusable on mobile. It struggles to load long documents & the slightest tilt of the phone triggers a loading error that, even once resolved & functional again, causes it to repeatedly flash the "app is unresponsive - close or wait" message every few seconds. Every time it happens, I have to fully shut down the app, reopen, wait through loading, then find my place again.

I am normally very happy with this app. However, when you updated it recently the update removed the word check where you select text and can see how many words there are in the selected area. There have also been problems with copying text and pasteing it from other documents. As a writer that uses this app, those features are paramount to my work. I would give this app five stars, but if I give you one star you might fix it faster. Thank you.

I have been having issues with Google Docs for years. It seems to have started with their auto-correct which doesn't even recognize when I mispell most words now. Now the phone app is practically unusable and on my computer it is only a little better. Looks like I have to go back to Word. Thanks a lot Google Docs. You have let me down for the last time.

It's auto correction is still jumps to absurd conclusions for words with only one or two letters off (which, ironically, seem to be no problem when using Chrome for spellchecks). It is a text based app, but can't even handle 100 pages without tapping out. It beats the user over the head with annoying pop-up notifications whenever it can/can't do something (like grammar suggestions). I'm basically having to conduct a mass exodus of my work off this headache.

I really enjoy the mobile app, the style is nice. But a recurring problem for the offline document feature, is that it takes ages to download my documents, for offline use, or editing. On both my Chromebook and android phone, a problem of the app crashing, or 'Not Responding' persists. It would be amazing if these problems were fixed to make the app run more smooth, and efficiently. I would recommend this app, and I appreciate, that it is free unlike similar apps, or software such as Microsoft Word. Keep up the good work, but please do better.

Docs works fine for me. At times the app will tell me about some synchronization error for very long documents and at other times it completely ignores it. Copy and paste, find and replace all work well too though I don't use them too often. Oh, and if the app is buggy on your phone it might actually be your phone. Make sure you aren't using an outdated device. Otherwise...well, yeah, things are going to slip...badly. Hardware and software only lasts for a few years. Further problems? YouTube.

Okay, after checking out a few more apps, I'm bumping this to 5 stars. For those that don't know, because many seem to not in the bad reviews, you can change font, size or almost anything about the text, it's just hidden behind a really strange and ambiguous button... For some really strange reason... But considering that Microsoft requires a SUBSCRIPTION PLAN to use all the features in something that is so pointless to pay for that it should be FREE, this is a hundred times better.

Lacks most word processing features. It's impossible to format in columns, there's no way to resize photos, and none of the features that make the web version so powerful are there. Plus, once the app is installed I can't get things to open in the web version. It keeps opening the app (or, when I stop the app from opening, it gets caught in a loop looking for the app). Make it like the web version and I'll happily reinstall.

It was good once upon a time, until a recent update messed with how the app responds to my phone's keyboard. The amount of lag I deal with is to the point where I cannot type coherent sentences without freezing, and the problem is not my phone. Keyboard works fine on every other app. I don't know what they did, but it doesn't work anymore. Edit 2: I am no longer able to edit any work from my phone. Huge disappointment. Use Microsoft or notes instead.

Always loved being able to open a doc on the app that I started on the computer, but lately I keep getting a box pop-up that tells me "cannot fix grammatical errors. Text is too long." Whatever that means. It's annoying & constantly pops up in the middle of my documents whether I'm proofreading or editing. It's always there, please fix that! So for now, the app is being deleted until that's fixed & I'll just have to use my computer to edit & proofread. It's rather unfortunate.

Docs is the most helpful word-processing app I have ever owned! It is very simple to use and has a huge variety of purposes you can use it for: book writing, resumes, letters, group projects, even typography if you know how to do it right. And it is a lot faster, takes up less space and is less laggy than it's competition, Word. Really recommend for your phone or handheld (and no, im not getting paid for this, Google is still pretty sketch in it's other dealings)

A writer's dream! It is useful for writing stories, because I can organize them into folders and color code them. Editing, sharing, organizing the folders is easy. The function of table of contents is useful for chapters, and the commenting is like post its. I love it because the app works on multiple devices smoothly. I especially love how (on android) to highlight text, you just hold your finger on the word, and it highlights it. This app is functional, easy, and highly recommended.

As a writer, I use Google Docs constantly. It's simple to use and the interface works fine for what I need it to do. But for the past MANY months, I've had issues with shared documents crashing, claiming it can't sync changes and making me revert, suddenly not allowing me to edit the document anymore, and the whole app simply giving up on loading certain documents. Update: my old phone was ancient. I now have a Google Pixel 7. The app still sucks. I'm removing a star just for that.

It's great. Wonderful tool to have, tons of fonts and tools to have, many ways to format things, it's wonderful. Never seen any lagging or glitching, never wanted any more from it other than rainbow as an option for the font color :) edit: actually, it would be really helpful to be able to find the most common word without having to search every single word in find and replace, and it would be great if there was an option to alphabetize it.

Pretty good but not excellent. i love how i can edit things right from my phone, but now it will not allow me to attach it to an email. It acts like it will l, but when you send the email, the doc and/or pdf is not attached. so this is actually a feature thats not working. this is a MAJOR inconvenience for someone that uses this in their business while they are on the go. Google, if you would fix this issue, your app would be great.

I love Google Docs. However, I give it 4 out of 5 stars because of an issue I am experiencing. When I try to print a google doc from my chromebook, the app freezes. In order to unfreeze the app, I have to shut down and restart my chromebook. 3/26/22 Update: With the latest update to my chromebook, the issue seems to have resolved itself. Hopefully it will continue to work!

Great, lacks 1 anecdotal feature. I like it, you can type across multiple devices no matter where you are. It has advantages over word just as word has advantages over it. The docs app is more mobile than the word app. I definitely prefer it to word with how I use it. The problem comes when I hook a keyboard and mouse to my phone (note 9). When I click it doesnt work on somethings and the scroll wheel doesn't work when in the app. I like using my phone instead of my laptop, but might use word.

I appreciate the different types of colors, and font; I really like the grammar correction and all the other things that come along with this app. Sometimes, there are shut offs unexpectedly or a little confusions on a word, but I can usually reroute what I need to say. The developer usually helps me. Sometimes the app crashes . Over all, I really like this app. My emoji don't seem to work well when I am sending out emails sometime. Thanks.

I've used this app for years to co write with a friend of mine. Its amazing and I use it daily, but the past week has been unbeadable. I can't type anything without a "synchronization error" popping up. I can't read what I'm typing as it flashes constantly above my keyboard. Nothing fixes it. This app needs fixed and updated and it's ridiculous it has gone on as long as it has.

Like others here have noted, the hitbox on the "jump to section" button on the right edge of the screen was recently changed in size. Now if you scroll through any large document with your right hand you inevitably end up hitting this section. There is a simple fix: require a long press gesture before activating to "jump to section" button. It's unlikely people are going to be able to jump to the correct section with a brief scroll or click gesture. I love this app. Please fix.

Pretty good app, has lots of nice features such as coloring text, etc. But it's also lacking a few features from the PC version that come in handy, such as special indent for paragraphs and the option to add more Google fonts. These are just a few I've noticed and it's not a big deal, I don't mind reformating documents on PC that I write on my phone. But how hard would it be to add a few more buttons and menus? Other than the missing features, pretty good app, would recommend to my friends :)

So much great but falls apart where it counts. I started using this because it converts the text formatting smoothly between mobile/PC (unlike other word processing apps). The functionality is great in that regards. However, it's extremely unreliable. I've had it happen more than once now that I've worked on a document on my tablet, and it gives me a notification that the document was saved in 'my drive,' but when I open the document on my phone, all the edits are gone. It just doesn't work.

I gave it five stars, because it has made things easier with my disability. However, voice to text seems to fail me often, which isn't exactly the apps issue. I have experienced multiple moments where the app freezes, and won't let me open until connecting to a Wi-Fi network. That is always a bit odd being as my mobile data is available. Not to mention, a bit annoying. There are no ads, but I have it set up this way through my settings.

One of the best apps for writing. Documents may be viewed from different devices, and when there's no internet! the built-in autocorrect is a little annoying, though. It doesn't interrupt the usage of the app, however, it sometimes mark things is grammatically incorrect when they shouldn't be. That's a very small nitpick, this is overall a great app for writing.

I've used and enjoyed this app for years, but this synchronization error message I've been getting the last few days is driving me nuts. I've uninstalled, reinstalled, logged in and out, cleared the cache and the data multiple times and it still pops up. And the whole time my docs have continued to sync without issue. It covers whole lines and text for extended periods and won't go away even though there is no sync issue. Please fix this.

Latest update removed the capability of selecting text, copying it, and adding a comment on it simultaneously. This was a feature that made this app useful. CORRECT IT BACK! Also- make the comments section useful: we need to be able to sort it any way we want, most specifically by newest, and once using one to find a comment (must add the capability of finding the section of the document even if the selected text has been removed - like in the case of correcting it) go back to where you were.

It's neat and elegant. Easy to use, even on a phone. Though I usually use the computer version of this app, I regard it with a high opinion. Sometimes, it doesn't refresh itself automatically, so recent files won't show at the top. Easy fix for this- refresh it yourself. Collaboration is easy. In real time, multiple people can work on a single document simultaneously.

Great on Other Platforms but Avg at Best on a phone. The mobile app, which is required instead of the chrome based version, is severely limited. You can type in it and print and for notes, that's fine. However if you actually want to edit the document appearance, adjust margins, fonts, etc, the features are simply not available. On PC & Chromebook, it's great. On a phone, not really. Mostly annoying for its limited usefulness.

It was working fine for years for me. I even pay for extra storage. Then suddenly over the last day or so, I keep getting an error. "Synchronization error. Please try again later." I tried everything from uninstalling, restarting my phone, turning off transfer files over wifi only, refreshing. Nothing works. I have the latest verison. There is no fixing.

I really like this app and use it all the time! Whether I'm writing stories or typing up information, it works wonderfully! Recently, the bottom menu had been changed to replace italics with a different bullet point system, which bothered me a lot and pushed me to just use Docs on PC exclusively, but it seems to be back to normal for me now, so that's great! I'd recommend this to anyone who does a lot of typing, especially across multiple devices.

I finally figured out what the problem with this app is! If you have a document that's 200 pages long it's a nightmare to edit. It will glitch out on you, repeating words randomly, freezing, its absolutely impossible. But if it's under 150 pages the app handles it pretty good. So if your writing out your cringe fanfictions on here like I am it's best to divide it up into parts after 100 pages to make sure the app doesn't freak out on you. Otherwise, you can view things perfectly

I've had this app for literal years and I have never had any issue with it. That is until recently. The past few updates have made typing on a doc kind of buggy. Like, it will lag for like 2 whole sentences, buggy. When I try to go back and edit a word it doubles the word I'm trying to fix. And some of my docs are having trouble loading. I love this app and I have alot of stuff on my google account. I would love to continue using it but it's starting to get really annoying.

Realistically, it's pretty much the perfect "simple" document app/program. It's not the most in-depth and ultra-feature detailed, but it has most of the necessary features. It could be spruced up with some more fancy options and definitely a way to fingerprint/password lock documents. Other than that it's a nice system. Please add biometric security, sooner rather than later though.

I love this app except for one small super annoying detail. There's a button along the right side to aid in scrolling large documents. It gets in the way when I try to correct typos on the bottom right of my screen. When I tap to correct, it sometimes pulls me up in the document because I accidentally hit the button. It gets frustrating quickly because the button appears when I don't need it.

It's a pretty alright app, though nowhere near as useful as the PC counterpart. The settings shouldn't have different options from the PC, and yet several options offered on PC are missing from the settings. The pop up error "text is too long for grammar dection" (paraphrasing of what it says) is annoying and makes trying to continue working on a doc annoyingly hard. Nearly unusable, even. If you're going to keep the pop up—make it appear only ONCE and then don't let it keep popping up!

After updating today (10/18/22), I can no longer use the scroll bar on the app to go by chapters or however it determined specific locations. It has also been probably since the beginning of the year but the "Can't detect more grammar errors. Text is too long." is still happening. I use this a lot on phone to do various works, and it makes it impossible to even do work when the message pops up every two seconds while typing.

I use this app all the time to write stories before posting them. It's just something that's convenient to have if I'm in a sudden mood for writing, especially at night. That being said, I really wish the app itself had a Dark/Night Mode option because honestly, my eyes feel so strained when writing at night or when in a dark room (during class lectures).

it has stopped opening large documents (over 100 pages or more) on my mobile phone. "who needs documents with over 100 pages? that's crazy!" I do. I like this app, it makes writing super easy on the go. not so if it keeps crashing. this makes it rather disappointing to use if I can't write. hopefully this issue can be looked at and resolved.

Google docs has been a game changer for the way that I work and is generally very good at what it does, but I've found some bugs whilst using a Chromebook in tablet mode. Everything functions as it should, but the backspace is like an crotchy old man. It needs to be prodded repeatedly to do its job, repeats things that were just written, and skips lines. It's basically unusable which, for my profession of deleting half of what I write (in other words, I'm an author), this is very frustrating!

I love this app. It has changed how I write, giving me the chance to scrubble down ideas throughout the day and work on them at my computer later. However, lately whenever a doc gets over a certain size, I cannot edit it without a ribbon constantly popping up and telling me the text is too long to check for grammatical errors. It's very annoying and I hope it is fixed soon.

Edit 10/22: Well, my original issue has yet to be fixed. On top of that, I've gotten a new bug of every time I edit "Can't detect more grammar errors. Text is too long." pops up. It's been months of it and years of my other issue. I use this a lot for my creative writing. I just wish I could figure out how to change paragraph spacing from the app, rather than the computer. Edit: Dropped my star rating because I constantly am not allowed to edit my own document after sharing it with a friend.

I use this app via mobile, so I'll cut it some slack when it comes to image uploads and formatting and etc. Overall it's a smooth, functional app that's been pretty decent to me. My primary complaint is with the lack of customization. The mobile app gives you a handful of fonts and no ability to import your own or link an add-on. The colors are preset, which doesn't let you mix and match shades and tints. Overall a good app and my preferred writing tool, but I'd love some more freedom.

Excellent app. Minor complaint though... when I'm reading a document and I want to go to my recent apps (with the swipe up gesture), Docs thinks I'm trying to scroll up initially. I can finally get it to go to the recent apps screen after a couple attempts though. This only happens with Google Docs. Scrolling on Chrome and Microsoft office is perfectly fine. One solution is to have the very bottom of the phone screen be dedicated to phone gestures instead of scrolling when using Docs.

I've been using this app for a while now and its been great when it wants to be. Unfortunately, whenever l use it on my chromebook it causes it to freeze! It gets very annoying and it kind of sucks that I can't figure out why it does that. Hopefully its just a bug and Google can fix this issue. I really want to make Google my primary for stuff like documents, excell, & powerpoint. I hope this review could help other chromebook users.

The new version, that it forced people to update, is so bad I did one file and it took me long time to do it. Then, suddenly it said "the file appears corrupted" and all of detail in my file just dissapeared, even I already saved it. When I click on the file I downloaded, it says "This file isn't available offline. Make it available offline in file option's menu", but it's online, not offline. The old version used to be good, now new version is just a piece of trash, takes up your space.

I had been totally enjoying this app until the past week. When I open it up it will not fully load and then crashes with a message "Google docs has closed unexpectantly". This problem is intermittent. It sometimes works fine and I'm on automatic updates, last updated Sept 6. I do not have more than recommended storage on the app, and I'd love to keep using it. Hoping the bug works itself out. Help!

Seems pretty decent, still learning the ropes. Online-offline working transition is peculiar, in so much as it doesn't keep some fonts around for offline work, so far as I know. Switching from Mac product and Pages to ChromeOS and Docs - still haven't figured our how to make only one page of a many paged document have columns yet. Maybe it can't, maybe I just haven't googled it, but it hasn't been exceptionally intuitive in that particular regard,along with a few others. Your mileage may vary.

Documents aren't updating consistently. No matter how many times I refresh the app, close and reopen documents, or close the app completely and reopen it, it's not updating changes to documents I open. Some of them are showing me versions that are several days old, and they won't let me edit them either, which tells me it knows they're not accurate, but it won't catch up and I can't figure out how to fix it. This bug makes the app legit unusable - I can't edit or write at all. Please fix!

Works great for basic documents, except when working with local files. For local files, local saves get incremental numbers appended. These pile up until I delete them and rename the latest. It also makes it harder to switch between apps that have different strengths, because I need to make sure to choose the most recent version from the pile. This has been a problem already, so once so far, I had to use Word on my laptop to compare documents and merge changes from 2 versions.

I love this app. I do have a few issues that keep me from putting five stars. I have a doc that im working in for a book and it takes FOREVER to load all the pages, no type of format saves when I copy and paste into and from the app and it deletes my things sometimes. My book is over 330 pages and I don't want to start over if the app decides to bug out. Edit: Still have a problem with loading but it goes a but faster now. If there's anything that will help, maybe a way to load pages faster.

I'll start out by saying that Google Docs used to be my favorite writing app. It was easy to use, the files were easy to share, the site itself was easily navigatable, it was awesome. NOT ANY MORE. The most recent update killed the app. If I could give it a zero star rating I would. It has been nothing but a nightmare especially when trying to save and share papers. Not to mention the fact that they completely re-did the writing page in a format with almost no tools or editing functions. Hate it

Absolutely hate to give this 1 star, but need to bring something to the developer's attention that multiple other reviews have mentioned: the new frequent annoying message that pops up "Can't detect more grammar errors. Text is too long". It appears right at the bottom of the document and completely covers what you're currently typing for about 5 seconds. The message then disappears and pops up again 3 seconds later. Over and over again. Absolutely no option to disable it. Please fix.

I like using Google docs, it's a great app for writing books and such. The only thing I'm not a fan of is the fact that you can't add fonts on moble/tablet. I use a tablet with a Bluetooth keyboard to write, and for my writing project, I need a font that is not already listed. I saw that it's possible to add downloaded fonts into your document, but that's only on PC.
data.replyText: Hi Lucy. Thanks for sharing your inputs! Our product team greatly values your feature suggestions. Please submit your feedback within Docs: click the 3 bar menu (top left) - Help & feedback - Send feedback.

data.text: Ever since I started using Docs, it was very easy for me to access it, especially the Explore feature where you can search the web without switching apps. After a day or two of not using Docs, I was gonna do a project and I can't find the Explore button!!! EDITED: Still no EXPLORE FEATURE, GDocs literally downgraded themselves. Please add this feature back, this has been stressing my out lately.
data.replyText: Hi Aiden. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. Also, we'll pass on your feedback to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: The Good: access anywhere. You never loose your work. The Bad: If your file is large, it becomes turtle slow. Can barely type. Edit: no longer useful. Only works if your work is short. New Edit: it works now but lacking side by side page view is ready stopping its full potential. I'm a visual person. I need to see a few pages all at once to see the flow of the writing. Just this one feature and it would be the best writing app out there.

I really enjoy using Google docs. It is easier to just copy and paste anything I have written on my note pad and the edit features are superb!. The only challenge I am having currently with this app is the fact that I sometimes cannot use the 'spell check' feature and then I find it difficult to access a document I have saved especially when it is really long. I usually have serious network glitches and it is really frustrating. I hope to get a response or a solution to this soonest. Thank you.

Google Docs for tablet feels completely different from the computer version. There are less features, I can't even collapse and expand headers, there are less colours for text, there's no comments, and format paint isn't even a tool I can use. There's no option or way to adjust the margins, and when I try to use it with a physical keyboard+trackpad, instead of scrolling like normal, the trackpad just highlights text. All I can say that's good about it is that it writes out text when I'm typing.
data.replyText: Hello Raphael, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: Well this is a dumb update. There is absolutely no way as far as I know now to make the font 17 instead of 18 on my phone and tablet. Plus when you click for font information, ok I like it's together now, however, I don't like how the keyboard covers have of it. Maybe should have beta tested first, or even Alfa tested. Please send reply for at least on how to make the font size slightly smaller than the presets.
data.replyText: Hello Ryan, thanks for sharing your valuable feedback! We'll pass this along to our team. You can check out this article for changing font size: https://goo.gle/3Tcvm7j We hope this helps!

data.text: It's a great app, I always use this for school, I recommend it. However there is a bug that I just encountered, Im trying to insert my photo from my album but it keep saying it can't be retrieved cz of bad connection. But I am literally using WiFi and the wifi is working well so idk why they said it's because of bad connection. I need to print it for my school assignment and it won't let me insert my photo, it's so annoying 😭. Pls help fix this bug

Most of the time, it works fine but when I needed it the most, it crashes. Some documents that are formatted in desktop format can't work properly which I find absurd since they should be working. Sure, I can edit them in my desktop but Iam a busy man and I don't have my desktop everywhere I go. I want to be able to edit my documents no matter where Iam on my phone. Fix this issue please.
data.replyText: Hi Adil. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Atrocious font formatting, bring back the old layout- it was perfect. Give us new options to set it however we want through a template. I understand if people would like to jump to 64pt immediately but, personally, I don't; it takes three taps instead of two to change the font sizes now, and the SIZE of the new font layout (taking half the the screen) is criminal; don't 1-to-1 bring PC's layout into mobile, it doesn't work. Learn some basic design principles; the greater user experience ruined

I have always used this application only when I strictly needed it. In recent years it has been very annoying to use, full of glitches and sometimes sudden crashes. This time that I used it, however, I noticed that it has definitely improved, it seems smoother and improved in general. I can't rate this app more then 3 stars because of all the freaks it caused me 🥲

I love how this app is easy to use and intuitive but the features that I actually needed is not here. Inserting shapes is not here, while offline, it doesn't let me insert photos and it can't be converted into pdf unless connected to the internet, and I can't even share the docs file using bluetooth or quick share. I hate it when apps are so dependent to internet when it is so obvious or possible that it should work while using it offline.
data.replyText: Hello Keanu. Thanks for sharing your valuable feedback. We'll pass this along to our team. Appreciate it!

data.text: Previously while using this app to write my books, I make some certain parts coloured which at point of downloading as rtf it remains like that but not almost everything I didn't touch to be coloured now gets colored and the colour is roughly spread through my book now making the book look rough. Please see to this as soon as possible.
data.replyText: Hi Ogoigbe. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: A very great application for documents! I've been using this for important projects, buy there's only one singular problem. When I edit a document to much, it's uneditable and can only edit it on another account. Besides that, no other problems so far!

This app suddenly closes in the background while using other apps for just a minute-and Every time we open it again, it goes out of the print view and- When we click in print mode for the first time after each save The page will be enlarged- I have already written a hundred page document on this program. This app is very useful. thanks
data.replyText: Hi Nafiseh. We suggest you clear apps cache on your device: Settings - Apps - Docs - Storage & cache - Clear cache. If that doesn't help, you may post your query in the Docs Community and get help from our experts: https://goo.gle/3o58rPT. Thank you.

data.text: Great app for documents on the phone. Its design is better than Microsoft Word if you ask me. The best part is how I managed to write a book and sell access to it in a safe and convenient way. I never have to worry about seeing people downloading my book without my consent. I mean, they can't even take screenshots. I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 because the 'Print layout' feature isn't available on mobile web. The app is great in all aspects.

Sad that the only files I can open with this app are .doc files. I expected a Google app called Docs to embrace all types of document files (reading and editing). Now I have to use ReadEra to read all other types of files. Maybe I'm wrong, but I've come to expect Google to give the best package in whatever genre it touches. Best meaning free, quick and fully comprehensive.

There is this bug where I accidentally downloaded something and then deleted off of the app. It was a collaboration document. When I entered the app again it was there. So I deleted it again, not wanting it there. The bug is that the deleted collaborated doc keeps reapearing in my main docs. It is not a major problem, but I would like it to be fixed.
